instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to map the medicinal crop psyllium husk in Jalore district of Rajasthan, India?
Output: To map the medicinal crop psyllium husk in Jalore district of Rajasthan, India,the researchers used remote sensing spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to map the medicinal crop psyllium husk in Jalore district of Rajasthan, India?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used to map the medicinal crop psyllium husk in Jalore district of Rajasthan, India included the modified soil adjusted vegetation index 2 (MSAVI2) derived from optical data and the radar vegetation index (RVI) derived from synthetic aperture radar (SAR) data.

instruction: What metric was chosen to map the medicinal crop psyllium husk in Jalore district of Rajasthan, India?
Output: The metric chosen to assess the outputs and determine the effect of heterogeneity in the mapped fields was the variance.

instruction: How did the study integrate optical temporal data with synthetic aperture radar (SAR) data to map the medicinal crop psyllium husk in Jalore district of Rajasthan, India?
Output: The study integrated optical temporal data with synthetic aperture radar (SAR) data by using vegetation indices derived from both types of data. Specifically, the modified soil adjusted vegetation index 2 (MSAVI2) was derived from optical data, while the radar vegetation index (RVI) was derived from SAR data. These indices were used to prepare temporal indices databases. Three different combinations of MSAVI2 and RVI layers, corresponding to different phenological stages of the psyllium husk crop, were studied to determine the effectiveness of different sensors for crop mapping.

instruction: How effective was the introduction of SAR-based vegetation index as a temporal layer in mapping the medicinal crop psyllium husk in Jalore district of Rajasthan, India?
Output: The introduction of SAR-based vegetation index as a temporal layer was found to be effective in mapping the medicinal crop psyllium husk in Jalore district of Rajasthan, India. The study used three different temporal layer combinations of MSAVI2 and RVI layers, corresponding to different phenological stages of the target crop. The results showed that the introduction of SAR-based vegetation index as a temporal layer gave good results for fully vegetated and harvest stages of the target crop. The variance within the mapped fields was observed to be as low as 0.0003.
